Recipe.title: Tres Leches Cake
Recipe.Source: From the kitchen of Rosey Tan Nelson
Recipe.Description: Tres Leches Cake is a treat common throughout Latin America. There are tons of recipes out there, but this is one is authentic.

section.title: Cake
section.instruction: Spray 9 &vector; 13 pan liberally with no-stick spray (such as Pam) and set aside.
In a large bowl, combine Flour, Baking Powder and Salt.
Separate Egg Yolks from Egg Whites.
Beat Egg Yolks with ¾ Cup Sugar on high speed until Yolks are a pale yellow.
Pour Egg Yolk mixture over the Flour mixture and stir very gently until combined.
Beat egg whites on high speed until soft peaks form.
With mixer on, add remaining ¼ cup Sugar and beat until egg whites are stiff but not dry.
Fold Egg White mixture into the batter very gently until just combined.
Pour mixture into greased pan and spread to even out the surface.
Bake at 350°rees; for 35-45 or until an inserted toothpick comes out clean.
Turn cake upside-down onto a platter.

section.title: Filling
section.instruction: In a separate bowl, combine Filling ingredients and mix well.
Remove 1 Cup of mixture. (It won't be used in this recipe.)
Punch holes in the cake with a fork, then drizzle remaining mixture all over the cake.
Combine Topping ingredients and mix well.
Drizzle icing all over the cake.

Notes.note: Be absolutely certain to remove 1 Cup of the Filling mixture before drizzling! Using all of it will ruin the cake. (On the other hand, you can use the leftover for whatever you want: Dipping sliced apples, pouring over sliced bananas, eating with a spoon, whatever.
